result.execSummary:
The defendant Victoria N Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 3 days was granted, if revoked. 
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence credit of 3 days was granted, if revoked. 
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County. 
See Count 1 for additional conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victoria N Scott

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:40 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Victoria N Scott in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Victoria N Scott. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and confirms with counsel they are prepared to proceed today.  State notes they have filed an amended information and recite the offer.  Atty. Martinez confirms the offer.  Atty. Martinez acknowledges receipt of the amended information, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea with respect to the amended Count 1.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1, and enters a guilty plea to Count 3.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3 of the Amended Information.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Martinez.


COUNT 1:
 The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld sentence (Court will award 3 Days Credit IF defendant is revoked and sentenced)

Term of Probation: 12 Months - Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with any Waukesha County Walmart store.
-	Take Thinking for a Change Course.

COSTS:  $253.00 (includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

COUNT 3:
 The Court Orders the Following:

Withheld sentence (Court will award 3 Days Credit IF defendant is revoked and sentenced)

Term of Probation: 12 Months - Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

Conditions of Probation:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with any Waukesha County Walmart store.
-	Take Thinking for a Change Course.

COSTS:  $243.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

**Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations. If the Defendant violates any terms of his/her probation, or has any condition time imposed, the Court will deem that the conditions precedent necessary for the conditional grant of Expunction have not been met and therefore Expunction is denied. The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:35 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Victoria N Scott in court.  Attorney Nicholas Martinez in court for Victoria N Scott.   Atty. Martinez provides an update, all discovery issues have been resolved and he has an offer.  Atty. Martinez is requesting a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:18 AM; Case called for Arraigment. Defendant Victoria N Scott in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Martinez acknowledges receipt of the information, waives reading and enters Not Guilty Plea.  Atty. Martinez provides an update, and is requesting a further proceedings date in August.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Arraignment on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:13 AM 
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Victoria N Scott in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  

Defense points out a defect in the compliant as to count 2 prior to proceeding to the waiver of prelim.
Therefore, Defense moves to dismiss count 2.
State would request that the matter be scheduled for arraignment in front of Judge Lau.

Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary hearing.
Court accepts the defendants waiver of prelim.
Preliminary Hearing Waived, matter is bound over.
Bail remains as fixed.
Information filed  Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and filed in court.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Request to adjourn prelim
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 04-15-2022. Granted.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

01:58 PM Defendant Victoria N Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:15 am.
